name: Chronic Myofascial Pain Syndrome
chief_complaint: I've had this constant deep muscle pain in my shoulders and neck for months, and it's not getting better.
physical_findings: palpable taut bands in affected muscles
local twitch response upon trigger point palpation
reduced range of motion in neck and shoulders
prognosis: Variable; often chronic but manageable with proper treatment and lifestyle modifications. Some patients achieve significant improvement with multimodal therapy.
description: A chronic pain disorder characterized by the presence of hypersensitive trigger points in skeletal muscles that cause localized and referred pain. These trigger points are palpable as taut bands within the muscle and can produce characteristic patterns of referred pain when compressed. The condition often develops after muscle overuse, trauma, or prolonged poor posture.
